intro: Thalictrum filamentosum f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy steeplebush, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value. Thalictrum filamentosum f. pubescens plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its habitat.
